cardinfo.CI: Adenanthera - Red Bead Tree/Red Bead Tree - Canopy.jpg

V: Red Sandalwood is a timber tree. This plant is found in the wild in India. Leaves are compound bipinnate, green when young, turning yellow when old. The small, yellowish flower grows in dense drooping rat-tail flower heads, almost like cat-tail flower-heads. Fruits are curved, hanging, green pods that turn brown, coil up and split open as they ripen to reveal small bright red seeds.These attractive seeds have been used as beads in jewellery, leis and rosaries. They were also used in ancient India for weighing gold. The seeds are curiously similar in weight. Four seeds make up about one gramme. Children love the hard red seeds and few can resist collecting the brightly coloured seeds usually littered under the tree. The young leaves can be cooked and eaten. the wood is extremely hard and used in boat-building and making furniture.

A red powder made from the wood is also used as an antiseptic paste. In Ancient Indian medicine, the ground seeds are used to treat boils and inflammations. A decoction of the leaves is used to treat gout and rheumatism. The bark was used to wash hair.

English: Red sandalwood, Coral-wood, Peacock flower fence
Assamese: Chandan
Bengali: রঞ্জনা, Ranjana
Gujarati: રક્તચંદન, બડી ગુમ્ચી, Badigumchi
Hindi: रंजना पेड़, रक्तचन्दन, कुचन्दन, बड़ी गुम्ची, बड़ी गुम्ची, रक्तचंदन, Raktakambal, Ranjana, Raktachandan, Rakt chandan, Badi gumchi
Kannada: ಆನೆ ಗೊಲಗನ್ಜಿ ಮರ, Ane golaganji
Konkani: Odlygunji
Malayalam: മഞ്ചാടി, Sem, Manchadi
Marathi: रतनगुंज झाड, रक्तचंदन, थोरला गुंज, Thorla goonj
Odiya: Sokakainjo
Sanskrit: Ksharaka, Kunchandana, Tamraka
Tamil: ஆனை குண்டுமணி மரம், ஆனைக்குன்றிமனி, திலம், மஞ்சாடி, Anai kundumani, Manjadi
Telugu: పెద్దగురుగింజ, బండి గుర్విన, Gurivenda, Enugaguruginji
